subject: I need your help!!
msgSnippet: hF GkRal My name is sylvain, I m a french student and I live in Berlin. I m studying graphic design and typography. I m doing a research about new alphabets.
messageBody:
hF GkRal


My name is sylvain, I'm a french student and I live in Berlin.
I'm studying graphic design and typography.

I'm doing a research about new alphabets. So I just discovered the Read Alphabet.
I hope I won't bother you with my questions, but with this e-group i may have the opportunity to talk with people who have much more experience and knowledge than me.

If someone of you could tell me if they know other new alphabets, (good or bad) or where I could find info about such alphabets?

I've already collected quite a lot of info about the Kingsley Read Alphabet, but what is not so easy to find is informations about type designers who have designed other versions of this alphabet.

I also found this in internet:
"The Shaw alphabet competition in the 50's drew hundreds of new alphabet proposals"
Does anyone have an idea about where I could find something about this very competitions, in particular about those other proposals?

Thank you very much for your attention.

I would be very glad to receive answers from you (in english, french or german).

Sylvain 

marmouzet@web.de
skype name: leboucherdehanovre

hF GkRal


My name is sylvain, I'm a french student and I live in Berlin.
I'm studying graphic design and typography.

I'm doing a research about new alphabets. So I just discovered the  
Read Alphabet.
I hope I won't bother you with my questions, but with this e-group i  
may have the opportunity to talk with people who have much more  
experience and knowledge than me.

If someone of you could tell me if they know other new alphabets,  
(good or bad) or where I could find info about such alphabets?

I've already collected quite a lot of info about the Kingsley Read  
Alphabet, but what is not so easy to find is informations about type  
designers who have designed other versions of this alphabet.

I also found this in internet:
"The Shaw alphabet competition in the 50's drew hundreds of new  
alphabet proposals"
Does anyone have an idea about where I could find something about  
this very competitions, in particular about those other proposals?

Thank you very much for your attention.

I would be very glad to receive answers from you (in english, french  
or german).

Sylvain
